definitions.definition: in favour of new ideas, modern methods and change

examples.text: Are you in favour of progressive teaching methods?
He is progressive, open-minded, and sincerely concerned with civil-rights struggles.
a progressive reduction in the size of the workforce

definitions.definition: connected with the form of a verb (for example I am waiting or It is raining) that is made from a part of be and the present participle. Progressive forms are used to express an action that continues for a period of time.
at a higher percentage as the total amount of money being taxed increases

examples.text: Supporters of a progressive income tax argue that it is fairer.
The government made the tax more progressive, ensuring that higher earners pay more.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from French progressif, -ive or medieval Latin progressivus, from progress- ‘gone forward’, from the verb progredi, from pro- ‘forward’ + gradi ‘to walk’.
